intro: Elcismia viscosa, commonly known as sticky elcismia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its sticky texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Elcismia viscosa is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
